reviewText: This is one of the most moving, inspiring DVDs I've seen. I watched it twice straight through. I was absolutely riveted by his devotion to helping unfortunate people in the world, the story of his own incarceration and torture, his continued determination to help women and children in Afghanistan help themselves. He challenges me to do so much more with my life than I had even thought to do, and I thought I WAS doing a lot to help others. Watch this! It will change your perspective and your life.
This is an excellent documentary about a photojournalist / humanitarian.

if you are interested in photography this is a great journey with one of the most humble and famous reporters.
Certainly worth seeing !
A worthy portrait of a great humanitarian, pacifist, journalist, artist, husband and father. An example for us all. Well put together, both visually and by interviews.
